00019 /** \file
00020   \brief Tools to open the sim port
00021 */
00022 
00023 #ifndef __SIMPORT_H
00024 #define __SIMPORT_H
00025 
00026 /// Whether serial data is into sim, or out from sim
00027 #define SERIAL_IN 0
00028 #define SERIAL_OUT 1
00029 
00030 /// Base class for virtual ports
00031 class OBDSimPort {
00032 public:
00033     /// Destructor
00034     virtual ~OBDSimPort();
00035 
00036     /// Get a string representing the port as it's exposed
00037     /** Take a copy if you care - the memory won't stay valid */
00038     virtual char *getPort() = 0;
00039 
00040     /// Enable or disable echo
00041     void setEcho(int yes);
00042 
00043     /// Find out if echo is set
00044     int getEcho();
00045 
00046     /// Enable or disable logging
00047     virtual int startLog(const char *filename);
00048 
00049     /// Enable or disable logging
00050     virtual void endLog();
00051 
00052     /// Write some data to the port
00053     /** If log is set to zero, the data isn't copied to log */
00054     virtual void writeData(const char *data, int log=1) = 0;
00055 
00056     /// Write some data to the logfile
00057     virtual void writeLog(const char *data, int out);
00058 
00059     /// Find out if this initialised correctly
00060     int isUsable();
00061 
00062     /// Read a line from the virtual port
00063     /** Take a copy if you care - the memory won't stay valid */
00064     virtual char *readLine() = 0;
00065 
00066 protected:
00067     /// Set usable
00068     void setUsable(int yes);
00069 
00070     /// Constructor. Can't construct these [base class]
00071     OBDSimPort();
00072 
00073     /// Whether or not to echo stuff
00074     int mEcho;
00075 
00076     /// log file
00077     FILE *mLogFile;
00078     
00079     /// Set when this is usable
00080     int mUsable;
00081     
00082 };
00083 
00084 #endif //__SIMPORT_H
